text: Gerald "Gerry" Byrne (29 August 1938 â€“ 28 November 2015) was an English footballer. He spent his entire playing career at Liverpool Football Club, playing from 1953 to 1969. He later played for the England national football team from 1963 to 1966. He was born in Liverpool, England. Byrne died in at a nursing home in Wrexham, Wales from Alzheimer's disease at the age of 77.Liverpool FC FA Cup final hero Gerry Byrne passes away aged 77 ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2015 deaths Category:1966 FIFA World Cup players Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease- related deaths in Wales Category:English footballers Category:Sportspeople from Liverpool
title: Gerry Byrne (footballer, born 1938)
